# TextareaInput A customizable textarea input component with validation support, multiple style variants, and accessibility features. ## Basic Usage ## Props Name Type Default Description `name` `string` - The name of the textarea field (used for form submission) `description` `string` - Optional description text to display below the label `hint` `string` - Optional hint text to display below the textarea `error` `string` - Error message to display (typically from Zod validation) `required` `boolean` `false` Whether the field is required `variant` `'default' | 'pill'` `'default'` Textarea variant - 'default' or 'pill' `coloredBorder` `boolean` `false` Whether to show a colored border (only applies to pill variant) `size` `'sm' | 'md' | 'lg'` `'md'` Size of the textarea - 'sm', 'md', or 'lg' `disabled` `boolean` `false` Whether the textarea is disabled `schema` `z.ZodType` - Zod schema for validation
## Examples ### Default Variant ```tsx ``` ### Pill Variant with Colored Border ```tsx ``` ### Different Sizes ```tsx ``` ## Validation The TextareaInput component supports Zod validation: ```tsx import { z } from "zod"; import { useState } from "react"; import { TextareaInput } from "@/components/ui/textarea-input"; export default function TextareaValidationExample() { const [error, setError] = useState(); // Schema to validate the text has a minimum length const schema = z.string().min(10, { message: "Feedback must be at least 10 characters", }); const handleValidate = (isValid: boolean, value: string, error?: string) => { setError(error); }; return ( ); } ``` ## Accessibility The TextareaInput component is built with accessibility in mind: - Proper labeling and ARIA attributes - Clear focus states for keyboard users - Error messages are properly associated with the textarea - Properly handles disabled states
